column4: Tashlikh must be performed in a salty body of water.
It is customary after reading the Book of Jonah to offer a prayer to all lost mariners.
Sadat is similar to terrestrial Sukkot, but one is required to build a covered raft rather than a booth. The moon must be visible through the canopy.
The Festival of Beacons similar to the terrestrial Hanukah, but instead of lighting candles, one must visit a new lighthouse each day.
One must locate their local circle of estuarine kohanot and ask for an invitation. If they accede, you may worship their tree.
Unlike Terrestrial Ashkenazim, Atlantic Aquatic Jews may eat corn, potatoes, and other starches on Pesach.
Do not sail on this day.
Aquatic Jews mourn the destruction of the Temple, but don't pray for its rebuilding, for in their exile, the sea is their Temple.
